items.text: length at leg stump, uses the angle to flick to fine leg
items.postText: AshKabir: "Unfortunately Bangladesh's lack of match practices when it comes to ODIs have cost them. They are coming on the back of a BPL season and their T20 style batting has stayed with them as evident from the rash shots that the batsmen have played to get themselves out. I really hope that the batsmen play more responsibly in the remaining two ODIs. "

items.preText: Neesham, other end. Over the wicket
items.text: length and wide outside off, left alone
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: short of a length just outside off, left alone
items.postText: Prasu: "139 is Lockie's slowest, he needs to develop slower delivery, it can be a weapon to him, like Tymal Mills back of the hand slower balls"
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: short of a length just outside off. Some extra bounce on this as he looks to carve to third man. Beaten on the outside edge
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: short of a length on leg stump, walks at it and tickles it to fine leg
short and down leg side. Just manages bat on this pull as it slides down. Fine leg cleans up
short of a length just outside off, run down to third man with an open face
angling in a bit too much, clipped away to fine leg easily
bangs one into the pitch outside off, he watches it go to the keeper
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: almost an action replay, a bouncer outside off, but this one's a wide for its height
follows up the bouncers with a full delivery on off, Saifuddin tries to turn it to leg but it shapes away and takes an edge to fly away to third man, because of the pace
quick and wide outside off, he sticks his bat out and the ball falls short of Taylor at gully. Taylor's finger takes a blow again
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: outside off again, driven through the covers for one
tries the yorker, it's a low full toss on leg and clipped away to deep midwicket for two in the gap
items.postText: Masud: "Not much comfort, but this NZ bowling attack scuttled India for 92 only the other day. How do Bangladesh batsmen practice playing Boult and company when no bowler in the country can bowl such swing at such pace? Can a bowling machine do swing at 150 kph?" I doubt it

items.text: bit short and wide, he slashes and gets runs square of the wicket
135.6kmh, angling away from just outside off, the angle and pac beat the outside edge
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: full on off stump, driven down with a straight bat to mid-off
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: on the pads this time, good pace and he takes it on the pads, missing the ball while trying to tuck it to leg
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: gives the charge for the ball outside off, and smashes it over the covers right off the middle of the bat
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Saifuddin, FOUR runs

items.text: slower bouncer around 120kmh outside off, bounces once again before the keeper as Saifuddin lets it go
items.shortText: Neesham to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.preText:
And Boult comes back, he has four left. No slips but there's a wide slip or gully

sarath4: "@Masud: That has been the problem for every team touring , not just for B'desh .. now-a-days focus more has been to win matches at home, not preparing domestic circuit that can play even in overseas"
items.text: starts with a short ball towards the throat, he hangs back and defends carefully
items.shortText: Boult to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: short again, this time more towards leg and he pulls it away for one
short to Saifuddin as well, he lifts his right leg a bit awkwardly while staying back and swats it towards square leg
slower one at 118kmh on the stumps, full as well, he pushes it into the covers for a quick single
full on off again, tucked away to deep square leg for one more
